revised_title: The Influence of Cerebral Cortex on Larynx: A Study on Abduction and Adduction of Vocal Cords
tldr: The author investigates the influence of the cerebral cortex on the larynx, specifically the abduction and adduction of vocal cords. The study finds that abduction is represented in the cerebral cortex, but adduction is more powerfully represented, making it difficult to obtain a stimulus strong enough to evoke abduction without also stimulating the adductor center.
